ranked_diseases.disease_name: Adrenal hyperplasia, congenital, due to 21-hydroxylase deficiency
ranked_diseases.explanation: This disease matches all the provided phenotypic features, including decreased testosterone, increased ACTH, decreased cortisol, increased prolactin, and increased estradiol, as seen in similar reference cases.

ranked_diseases.disease_name: Adrenal hyperplasia, congenital, due to 11-hydroxylase deficiency
ranked_diseases.explanation: Although it presents with some hormonal imbalances similar to the case, it is less common and doesn't typically show estradiol elevation.

ranked_diseases.disease_name: Congenital adrenal hyperplasia due to 17-alpha-hydroxylase deficiency
ranked_diseases.explanation: This condition can lead to similar adrenal hormone profiles but with a different hormonal effect, particularly with higher levels of adrenal steroids other than cortisol.
